text_blocks.text: LOK SABHA
BULLETIN – PART I
(Brief Record of Proceedings)
Friday, March 20, 2020/Phalguna 30, 1941 (Saka)
No. 79
1.  Starred Questions

Starred  Question  Nos.  381–383,  384(clubbed  with  400),  386  and  387  were orally answered.  Members in whose names Starred Question Nos. 385  and  400  were  listed,  were  absent.    However,  Ministers  concerned  laid  the  replies on the Table. Supplementary Questions to Starred Question Nos. 385  and 400 were asked by the Members.  Replies to Starred Question Nos. 388– 399 were laid on the Table.

children.text: Starred  Question  Nos.  381–383,  384(clubbed  with  400),  386  and  387
were orally answered.  Members in whose names Starred Question Nos. 385
and  400  were  listed,  were  absent.    However,  Ministers  concerned  laid  the
replies on the Table. Supplementary Questions to Starred Question Nos. 385
and 400 were asked by the Members.  Replies to Starred Question Nos. 388–
399 were laid on the Table.

text_blocks.text: 2.  Unstarred Questions
Replies to Unstarred Question Nos. 4371–4600 were laid on the Table.
12.00 Noon
3.  *Observation by the Speaker
The Speaker made an Observation regarding commencement of sitting  of the House for 23  March, 2020 at 2.00 P.M. instead of 11 A.M.

of the House for 23 rd  March, 2020 at 2.00 P.M. instead of 11 A.M.

text_blocks.text: 6.  Messages from Rajya Sabha

Secretary General reported the following messages from Rajya Sabha:-   (i) That  at  its  sitting  held  on  the  18   March,  2020,  Rajya  Sabha  passed  the  National  Commission  for  Indian  System  of  Medicine  Bill, 2020.

text_blocks.text: 12.  Motion
Shri Pralhad Joshi moved the following motion :-
"That this House do agree with the Fifteenth Report of the Business  Advisory Committee presented to the House on 19  March, 2020."  The motion was adopted.

text_blocks.text: “Having  regard  to  the  fact  that  due  to  scarcity of water  and  unavailability  of  fodder  for  cattle  in  the  Bundelkhand  region  of  the  State of Uttar Pradesh, the people of the region are forced to leave  their cows to graze in the open, which is popularly known as  and which causes damage to the standing crops, this House  urges upon the Government to take steps to construct a network of  canals from the proposed Ken-Betwa river-linking project in order to  inter-connect  and  replenish  the  dams  and  ponds  to  overcome  the  problem of water scarcity and practice of   in the region.”

text_blocks.text: 18.  Private Members' Resolution – Under Consideration

Shri Ritesh Pandey moved the following resolution:- “Keeping  in  view  that  the  Anganwadi  Workers  and  Anganwadi  Helpers  provide  many  essential  health  and  welfare  services  to  women,  children  and  adolescents,  this  House  urges  upon  the  Government  to  take  following  immediate  steps  to  uplift  their  working conditions -

children.text: Shri Ritesh Pandey moved the following resolution:-
Shri Ritesh Pandey
moved the following resolution:-
“Keeping  in  view  that  the  Anganwadi  Workers  and  Anganwadi
Helpers  provide  many  essential  health  and  welfare  services  to
women,  children  and  adolescents,  this  House  urges  upon  the
Government  to  take  following  immediate  steps  to  uplift  their
working conditions -

text_blocks.text: (1) regularisation  of  employment  of  Anganwadi  Workers  and
Anganwadi Helpers;
(2) changing  the  nomenclature    of    compensation  category  of  Anganwadi Workers and Anganwadi Helpers from “Honorarium”  to “Salary”;

children.text: (2) changing  the  nomenclature    of    compensation  category  of
changing  the  nomenclature    of    compensation  category  of
Anganwadi Workers and Anganwadi Helpers from “Honorarium”
to “Salary”;

text_blocks.text: (3) payment  of  adequate  amount  of  compensation    to  Anganwadi  Workers and Anganwadi Helpers, which would reflect importance  of their services to the  society;

children.text: (3) payment  of  adequate  amount  of  compensation    to  Anganwadi
payment  of  adequate  amount  of  compensation    to  Anganwadi
Workers and Anganwadi Helpers, which would reflect importance
of their services to the  society;

text_blocks.text: (4) improving  working  conditions  of  Anganwadi  Workers  and  Anganwadi Helpers and upgrading  every Anganwadi Centre with  all  basic  facilities  including  availability  of  Safe  drinking  water,  clean toilets and proper ventilation; and

children.text: (4) improving  working  conditions  of  Anganwadi  Workers  and
improving  working  conditions  of  Anganwadi  Workers  and
Anganwadi Helpers and upgrading  every Anganwadi Centre with
all  basic  facilities  including  availability  of  Safe  drinking  water,
clean toilets and proper ventilation; and

text_blocks.text: (5) payment  of  all  dues  including  pending  rent  for  Anganwadi  Centres  which  are  being  run  on  rented  accommodation    in  the  country.”.

children.text: (5) payment  of  all  dues  including  pending  rent  for  Anganwadi
payment  of  all  dues  including  pending  rent  for  Anganwadi
Centres  which  are  being  run  on  rented  accommodation    in  the
country.”.
